lines.text:
[Tasting her soup at the dinner table]
Oh, it's hot!
One does not blow on one's soup.
Oh, doesn't one?

There are several schools of thought in the art of soup cooling. There are the blowers, and the fanners, the diluters with ice water, and the wait-til-it-coolers. Now I belong to the old school. The toughies. We take our soup straight and if it burns us, we just laugh it off, see?
Here lies Jane Dana. Scientist and spinster. She died at the age of 82. A nice girl.
Hector Titus, what ails you?
Don't you know?
No.
Listen.
[Blows his postman's whistle three times]
For Uncle Sam, I toot twice. But three times means I love you.

[to Jane]
Speaking as an authority, I'd say you were the nicest girl in the world.
I'm afraid I'm not very sophisticated.
Now you are being young. Real sophistication, dear, is just another name for good taste.
Who wants to be just useful and contented? After all, I'm not a cow.
I found out what men really are. Apes. All of them. Apes. After today, I look on all men with impunity.
First I'd look up impunity in the dictionary.

[Crying]
I did something so stupid. So cheap. I threw myself at him. He didn't even kiss me. He didn't even try.

[Smiling with relief]
Why, the bounder!
I'm not sure where Samoa is, do you?

[Pointing]
Yeah, it's right over that way.

[Sarcastically]
Oh, now I know.
Well, all I know is that Robert Louis Stevenson said, "To get to Samoa you go to the Pacific Ocean and turn left."
Well, we live only once.

[laughs]
Yeah, stingy, isn't it? We should have at least two. Our own and a good one.
Don, I'm afraid I did some things that must have hurt you a lot.
I only remember the things you did that didn't.

[In the car with Jane]
Listen to her purr. She doesn't growl, she doesn't groan. She just purrs. Isn't that beautiful?

[Mocking]
Beautiful.
What this town needs is a good five cent scandal!
What would you like? Ice tea, ice coffee or milk?
Champagne.
You're not going to marry anybody but me. Everybody knows that.
Everybody but me.
Don't you care about me?
Let's take that up later, Hector... or let's not.
